since_last_update: Dominant driver remains trade-policy shock: reports point to President Trump threatening new tariffs on imports from eight European countries tied to Greenland dispute, triggering risk-off in US equities and bid for havens (AP, Barron's; Bloomberg cited via Yahoo Finance).

Cross-asset signature of the move: equities sold off while precious metals caught strong safe-haven demand; gold and silver printed record-high headlines around the tariff escalation narrative (AP; Bloomberg via Yahoo Finance; Reuters via Economic Times).

Rates/financial-conditions overlay: selling in duration-heavy equities coincided with higher long-end yields in the Tuesday move, reinforcing the 'yields up + equities down' adverse mix flagged in prior risks (AP).

Incremental confirmation that the 'trade-policy escalation/retaliation cycle with Europe' risk in prior_state is no longer a tail risk but a front-page spot driver for index futures and gold (AP; Reuters via Economic Times).
today_focus: Session playbook: treat 'trade headlines (tariffs/retaliation/Greenland comments)' as the primary tape bomb; expect index futures and gold to respond first to any de-escalation/escalation language (AP; Bloomberg via Yahoo Finance).

Watch whether the market shifts from pure headline risk to 'earnings + guidance under tariff uncertainty' framing; early examples show guidance/tariff-hit talk can dominate single-name moves and spill into index breadth (Barron's; Reuters).

Gold focus: safe-haven bid appears driven more by geopolitical/trade uncertainty and USD softness than by clean disinflation; risk is a fast reversal if trade rhetoric cools or real yields reassert upward pressure (Bloomberg via Yahoo Finance; AP).

Rates sensitivity: if long-end yields rise again alongside equity weakness, it tightens financial conditions and pressures duration-heavy Nasdaq; if yields fall on growth fear, downside may migrate toward cyclicals/credit instead (AP; inference).

market_pricing.dominant_driver: Trade-policy/geopolitical risk (US-Europe tariffs linked to Greenland dispute) driving risk-off in US equities and safe-haven demand in precious metals (AP; Bloomberg via Yahoo Finance; Reuters via Economic Times).

equities.what_is_priced: Higher policy-risk premium and growth uncertainty from potential tariff implementation/retaliation; pressure concentrated in tech/duration and trade-exposed groups (AP; Barron's).
equities.what_is_underpriced: Second-order effects: retaliation scope, supply-chain/price-level impacts, and the possibility of repeated headline-driven gaps that overwhelm systematic re-risking; also the risk of 'bad mix' where yields rise during equity drawdowns (inference; AP).

rates_usd.what_is_priced: Some tightening in financial conditions via long-end yield pressure during the initial shock; USD softness appears consistent with policy-uncertainty and haven rotation rather than clean risk-on/off USD behavior (AP; Bloomberg via Yahoo Finance).
rates_usd.what_is_underpriced: Policy-path tail: if tariff rhetoric feeds inflation expectations, front-end could reprice hawkish even as equities weaken (stagflation-ish risk), which would be negative for both NQ and duration (inference).

gold.what_is_priced: Elevated geopolitical/trade uncertainty premium and demand for hedges against policy-driven inflation uncertainty (AP; Reuters via Economic Times; Bloomberg via Yahoo Finance).
gold.what_is_underpriced: Downside risk if narrative flips to rapid de-escalation or if real yields move sharply higher; upside risk if retaliation broadens or policy uncertainty persists into Feb tariff start window (inference).

risk_register.risk: Escalation/retaliation cycle: concrete tariff timetable (10% from Feb with potential escalation later) increases likelihood of European countermeasures, prolonging risk-off and complicating inflation expectations.
risk_register.timeframe: Days to weeks (into Feb 2026 implementation window)

risk_register.risk: Adverse cross-asset regime: equities draw down while long-end yields rise, causing valuation compression (esp. Nasdaq) and tightening financial conditions.
Headline-gap / liquidity air-pocket risk around political statements and Davos-related soundbites; systematic flows may amplify whipsaws.
Gold whipsaw risk: safe-haven premium vulnerable to sudden détente headlines; alternatively can extend if trade risk morphs into stagflation narrative.

Macro data reprice risk: core PCE and PMI could override tariffs narrative temporarily by moving real rates; upside inflation surprise would be particularly toxic for NQ and supportive for gold via uncertainty channel.

event_warnings: Jan 21, 2026: President Trump speaks (scheduled); highest sensitivity given tariffs/Greenland linkage—expect cross-asset gaps if language escalates or de-escalates.
Jan 21, 2026: Pending Home Sales and Construction Spending—secondary, but could matter if rates narrative is already unstable.
Jan 22, 2026: US Final GDP and Weekly Claims—can move growth vs inflation balance if revisions are non-trivial.
Jan 22, 2026: Core PCE m/m—key rates catalyst; could dominate the session even amid trade headlines.
Jan 23, 2026: US Flash PMIs—high-frequency growth/prices mix; can swing both yields and equity multiples quickly.
